RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 1 5F Dirt CR: 85. Maiden Special Weight Purse 90000. (UP TO $15,660 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CALL THE CAVALRY bobbled shortly after the start, was well placed just off the pace on the inside, came through a rail opening to make a bid into upper stretch, shook clear while asked for his best inside the three-sixteenths and proved much the best under a hand-ride while flagged with a right-handed crop. ROCK STAR BOY was hustled from the gate then chased the pace, went two then three wide on the turn, gained to make a bid at the five-sixteenths, turned into upper stretch on even terms for the lead, lost touch with the winner inside the three-sixteenths, remained on his inside lead until outside the sixteenth-pole, swapped to the proper lead when thrown in by the rider to encourage that switch at juncture and determinedly earned the place. EVERY FOUR YEARS was bumped soundly at the start, chased the pace on the outside, went four wide on the turn, pursued the winner while outside in the drive, fought with the runner-up for the place and just missed that position while clear for the show. DREW D'ORO broke out and bumped soundly with a rival, went to the front, dropped from the three path to the two path early on the turn, lost the advantage into the stretch and faded. REAPPLY brushed the inside of the gate at the start, dropped well behind, went around the turn in the two path and was no factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Call the Cavalry
ENTRY.OWNER: Back Racing LLC Run for LaRoses and Magdalena Racing (Sherri McPeek)
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled after brk,well placed,ins turn,slip thru 1/4,bid3/16,clr

ENTRY.NAME: Reapply
ENTRY.COMMENT: brushed inside gate,dropped back,2path turn,no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Rock Star Boy
ENTRY.OWNER: Cotrone Robert and Rodriguez Rudy R
ENTRY.COMMENT: hstld,chsd,2-3p turn,bid5/16,ins lead to ins1/8,game for 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Drew d'Oro
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out,bmpd,pace,3-2path turn,headed1/4,faded

ENTRY.NAME: Every Four Years
ENTRY.OWNER: Caruso Michael J and Dubb Michael
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd hard brk,chsd outside,4path turn,kept on,miss2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 2 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 82. Claiming Purse 39000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since December 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Othe rwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HANG TIGHT got brushed at the start by UNION LIGHTS, who broke inwards, settled in pursuit two then three wide at the tail of the field, grew detached from the main body of the field into the far turn and came under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled five wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive steadily gaining on embattled rivals up front, collared the lot seventy yards from home and prevailed edging away at the end. CUMBERLAND BLUES four then three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung three to four wide into upper stretch, dug in heads apart for command to the sixteenth pole, ran on to secure the place honors. CHEEKY TICO led early on before being displaced by UNION LIGHTS to the inside, prompted that rival from the outside three then two wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, spun two to three wide for home, rallied to take command between rivals just inside the eighth pole, dug in under a drive and was caught seventy yards from home and kept on to preserve the show honors. MO REWARDS coaxed from the gate, chased just off the inside until tucked inside into the far turn, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, dug in behind foes and tipped out to the five path a furlong from home, then weakened to the finish. UNION LIGHTS broke in at the start brushing HANG TIGHT, came under coaxing and advanced to be forwardly placed before taking over command seven furlongs out, showed the way in hand along the inside under some pressure from CHEEKY TICO to the outside, got placed to coaxing at the three-eighths, took the inside route into upper stretch under threat, dug in under challenge and relented just inside the eighth pole, then weakened to the finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Hang Tight
ENTRY.COMMENT: brushed st, 2-3w at rear, 5w uppr, up fin 70yds, edged away

ENTRY.NAME: Union Lights
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in st, up 7/8, in hand ins, ins 1/4, collared ins 1/8, wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Mo Rewards
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 2p, coaxed ins 3/8, 2w 1/4p, tip 5w 1/8, wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Cheeky Tico
ENTRY.OWNER: Three Player's Stable and Barrera III Oscar S
ENTRY.COMMENT: led early, prompted 3-2w, coaxed 3/8, 2-3w uppr, led, caught

ENTRY.NAME: Cumberland Blues
ENTRY.OWNER: Final Turn Racing Stable LLC and Celeritas Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-3w pursuit, coaxed 3/8, 3-4w upper, ran on

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 93. Claiming Purse 36000. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Weight, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 1 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500 (Maiden And Claiming Races For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Other wise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LEDDY was hustled from the start, tracked the pace on the outside, chased in the two path on the turn, made a bid in the three path while between foes at the quarter-pole, fought inside of the runner-up into the final furlong, shook clear under a right-handed crop outside the sixteenth-pole and proved much the best while placed under a hand-ride in the final sixteenth. THREE TWO ZONE settled off the pace, went two then three wide on the turn, gained in the four path to take a short lead into upper stretch, battled outside of the winner into the final furlong and proved no match while able to get the place. JALEN JOURNEY was urged along on the outside, went three then four wide on the turn, was driven five wide into the stretch and lacked the needed kick then missed the place while clear for the show. PRINTRACK went to the front, vied inside on the turn, was asked near the five-sixteenths, lost the advantage in the two path into upper stretch and gave way. MOTION TO STRIKE broke in and bobbled while off a bit slow then was taken up while recovering, moved up to race just off the pace then was taken under a stout hold while tugging very hard on the bit, remained eager under vigorous restraint behind the leader while inside on the turn, was let out some at the five-sixteenths, waited coming to the quarter-pole, had a hole open along the fence into the stretch, steadied when that hole tightened near the three-sixteenths, continued to steady behind the tiring pacesetter until near the furlong marker then finally moved out and had nothing left in a tough journey.

ENTRY.NAME: Motion to Strike
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in,bobbld,tkn up,hard held,keen,ins,stdy3/16-1/8,stdy,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Three Two Zone
ENTRY.OWNER: Alonzo Racing LLC Bagnoli Michael and Bagnoli Jacqueline
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled,asked 2-3wide turn,bid1/4,led4p3/16,no match,held2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Printrack
ENTRY.COMMENT: went to front,pace,ins turn,asked5/16,headed2p3/16,gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Jalen Journey
ENTRY.COMMENT: urged along,3-4wide turn,5w into lane,lacked needed kick

ENTRY.NAME: Leddy
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,tracked outside,chsd 2p trn,bid3p1/4,clr outside1/16,best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 80. Claiming Purse 28000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LET FREEDOM SPRING established the front from the get go and showed the way in hand from the two path briefly before being engaged on the front just inside five furlongs to run by GINNSU WARRIOR to the outside, tucked inside through the turn knocking heads with his main pace rival and came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, edged clear under a drive kept to task. CENTRAL PRIDE coaxed from the gate, chased four then three wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled five wide into upper stretch, offered up a mild kick and was just up for the place honors in the final jumps. GINNSU WARRIOR three wide in pursuit early on, advanced inside five furlongs remaining to duel outside of LET FREEDOM SPRING through the turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch, got shaken off nearing the eighth pole and weakened in the late stages. CLASH A. J. a bit fractious in the gate, chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled three to four wide into upper stretch, weakened. REUNION TOUR coaxed from the gate, chased just off the inside coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, angled four wide at the head of the stretch, tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Reunion Tour
ENTRY.OWNER: Ferraro James W Barbati Kenneth B and Citarella Diana
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 2p, coaxed 7/16, angled 4w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Clash A. J.
ENTRY.COMMENT: bit fractious gate, chased ins, coaxed 3/8, 3-4w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Central Pride
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 4-3w, coaxed 3/8, 5w upper, mild kick, up 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Ginnsu Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w pursuit, advanced ins 5/8, dueled 2p turn, 3w uppr, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Let Freedom Spring
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand 2p, dueled ins turn, coaxed 5/16, 2w 1/4p, edged clear

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 5 1 1/16M Turf CR: 74. Maiden Claiming Purse 47000. (UP TO $8,178 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Claiming Price $40,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to r un this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile and One Sixteenth on the Main Track.) (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STJAMES was unhurried near the rear of the field, moved from the two path to the five path on the turn, gained late on that bend, rallied outside in upper stretch and closed strongly to get up late. STEADY SCHEMING was last to commence then reserved off the pace, went four then five wide on the turn, rallied to the lead in upper stretch, led under a drive into the final sixteenth but was caught while able to get the place. ELEVATED CAUSEWAY was reserved off the pace, moved from the rail to the three path on the turn, was held up behind horses from the three-eighths pole to the five-sixteenths then checked off heels, came four wide into the stretch, drifted in outside the furlong marker and finished willingly for the show. THEREGOESMYMIRACLE went to the front, showed the way on the inside through solid fractions, was asked at the quarter-pole then lost the advantage in upper stretch, fought inside of the winner into the final furlong and weakened. NIEUWENDYK settled on the outside, was roused four wide on the turn, gained to make a bid in upper stretch, dropped back into the final furlong and tired. SHAKIN THE BELLE showed speed between foes then tracked the pace, traveled around the turn in the two path and came up empty. PEJA DU became rank under restraint outside the three-quarter pole then lost action some near that pole, continued rank under a tight hold, took an awkward stride near the half-mile pole then dropped back, checked near the five-sixteenths and capitulated. GLOBALIZATION settled at the rear, moved from three to five wide on the turn and showed little. ETERNAL GLORY showed speed between foes then was rated off the pace, dropped back three then four wide on the turn, checked while falling out of contention near the five-sixteenths then moved to the five path and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Theregoesmymiracle
ENTRY.COMMENT: went to front,inside pace,asked1/4,headed3/16,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Elevated Causeway
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved,ins-2path turn,held up3/8,checkd5/16,4w,drift in1/8,gain

ENTRY.NAME: Shakin the Belle
ENTRY.OWNER: MC Stables and Rodriguez Rudy R
ENTRY.COMMENT: between early,tracked,urged 2path turn,empty

ENTRY.OWNER: Ritz III William J and Nahal Henry J
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed btwn,rated,drop back 3-4w turn,checked5/16,5w,faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Stjames
ENTRY.OWNER: Gyarmati Leah Brooklyn Racing Co and Windborne Farm
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried,2-5w turn,gained5/16,rallied outside,closd fast,up late

ENTRY.NAME: Peja Du
ENTRY.COMMENT: rank,hard held,lost action3/4,awkward stride1/2,chckd5/16,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Steady Scheming
ENTRY.OWNER: Flying P Stable and West Paces Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: last away,reserved,4-5w turn,rallied,lead3/16,led to late,denied

ENTRY.NAME: Nieuwendyk
ENTRY.OWNER: McMahon Michael J Begg James Bentley Stavropoulos Tommy Siegel Bart Copper Beech
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled outside,roused 4wide turn,bid 3/16,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Globalization
ENTRY.OWNER: Summers Chad and Hardoon Joseph R
ENTRY.COMMENT: at rear, 3-5wide turn, showed little

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 6 1M Dirt CR: 77. Claiming Purse 39000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since December 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MURSAL coaxed from the gate, chased five to six paths off the inside early on before tucking four wide with nine-sixteenths to go, tucked three wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths and advancing through the latter portion of the bend to issue a challenge swinging four wide into upper stretch, took over command straightened away, edged clear under a drive to prevail. APRIL ANTICS chased along the inside down the backstretch and then just off the inside through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled six wide into upper stretch, kept on under a drive to be along clear of the rest and second best. LIBERTY FLAME forwardly placed from the start, advanced to take command six furlongs from home and showed the way in hand just off the inside, tucked inside through the turn, came under coaxing near the quarter pole under pressure and spun just off the inside into upper stretch, yielded the front straightened away into upper stretch and weakened. RACING COLORS broke out at the start, chased seven paths off the inside down the backstretch and then three wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, went six wide into upper stretch and passed tired rivals to the finish. SIMPLE SUGAR led early on five paths off the inside before being displaced on the front by LIBERTY FLAME with six furlongs to run, tucked four then three wide before making her way to the two path through the turn coming under coaxing three furlongs out, spun just off the inside into upper stretch in retreat and tired. LONDON GOLD fractious in the gate leaping up prior to the start, chased just off the inside until tucked inside through the turn, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, folded and was eased home to the finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Liberty Flame
ENTRY.OWNER: Begg James Bentley and Upland Flats Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand 2p, ins turn, coaxed near 1/4, 2w 1/4p, yielded, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: London Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious gate, chased 2p, ins turn, 2w 1/4p, folded, eased

ENTRY.NAME: Mursal
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, 5-6w early, chased 4-3w, 4w upper, up, edged clear

ENTRY.NAME: April Antics
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased ins, coaxed 2p 3/8, angled 6w upper, kept on, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Simple Sugar
ENTRY.COMMENT: led early 5w, chased 4-3w, 2p turn, coaxed 3/8, 2w 1/4p, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Racing Colors
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, 7w backstretch, 3w turn, 6w upper, passed tired foes

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 7 1 1/8M Inner turf CR: 91. Starter Allowance Purse 65000. INNER TURF (UP TO $11,310 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $50,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN OR CLAIMING. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since December 1 Allowed 2 lbs. (Rail at 35 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PIONEERING SPIRIT went around the first turn in the two path, was unhurried towards the rear, moved from the two path to the five path on the far turn, rallied outside into upper stretch, closed strongly to get the lead outside the sixteenth-pole then moved clear under steady handling. MORE THAN WORK rounded the first turn in the two path, stalked the pace on the outside, turned up the pressure in the two path on the far turn, took the lead into upper stretch, inched away coming to the furlong marker, was quickly collared by the winner inside that marker and proved no match late while able to get the place. BORN A GAMBLER was rated just off the pace on the inside, moved to the two path under some urging around the five-sixteenths, swung four wide into the stretch, pursued the leader into the final sixteenth and weakened while able to get the show. BLAME D RULE MAKER hit the outside of the gate at the start, went three wide on the first turn, was rated just off the pace on the outside under a strong hold, raced three wide while let out on the far turn, came five wide into the stretch, pursued the leader under a drive into the final furlong and also weakened. PARQUETRY went three wide on the first turn, was rated just off the pace, shifted from the two path to the four path while asked on the far turn, turned five wide into upper stretch and lacked the needed kick. URBAN MYTH bumped soundly with a foe into the first turn, saved ground on that bend, was rated just off the pace, dropped back with five furlongs to run, raced inside on the far turn, came out under a drive into upper stretch and lacked the needed response. NO REGARD went to the front, rounded the first turn in the two path, showed the way while in hand, vied inside on the far turn, was asked outside the quarter-pole, lost the lead into upper stretch and gave way. PENNER ASH (IRE) was last to commence, traveled three wide on the first turn, settled towards the rear, shifted from three to five wide on the far turn, dropped to the four path near the quarter-pole and failed to threaten. WINNING CONNECTION bumped soundly with a rival nearing the first turn then checked, saved ground on that bend, lagged at the rear, went two then three wide on the far turn, came out near the quarter-pole and was eased but walked off.

ENTRY.NAME: Winning Connection
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd into 1st turn,checked,ins1st,at rear,eased,walked off

ENTRY.NAME: Born a Gambler
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated inside,just off pace,2p5/16,swung 4w1/4,chased,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Urban Myth
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd into 1st turn,rated inside,drop back 5/8,ins2nd turn,no kick

ENTRY.NAME: More Than Work
ENTRY.OWNER: Politano James and Northeast Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p1st,stalked,2p2nd turn,took lead 3/16,overtaken,held place

ENTRY.NAME: Parquetry
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w1st,rated just off pace,2-4w2nd,5w1/4,lacked needed response

ENTRY.NAME: Penner Ash (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: last away,3w1st,settled,3-5w2nd turn,4w1/4,no threat

ENTRY.OWNER: That's Amore Stable Hill Nakia R Smothers Stewart and Transfiguration Stable LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p1st turn,pace,ins2nd turn,headed 3/16,gave way

ENTRY.COMMENT: hit gate,3w1st,rated outside,3w2nd,ask,5w1/4,chased,wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Pioneering Spirit
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p1st,unhurried,2-5w2nd turn,6w1/4,rallied,closed strongly,clear

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 8 7F Turf CR: 94. Waiver Claiming Purse 70000. (UP TO $12,180 NYSBFOA) FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Weight, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 1 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $40,000 (Maiden And Claiming Races For $32,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Du e At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Seven Furlongs on the Main Track.) (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BRING ME A CHECK chased three wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, continued three wide for home, rallied to take command just inside the eighth pole, edged away kept to task. BALLYDOOLEY (GB) three then two wide in closest aim of the leader, came under coaxing near the quarter pole, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and took over command straightened away, got collared a furlong out, ran on to preserve the place honors. HIGH TIDE chased two to three wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, went six wide into upper stretch, kicked on belatedly to secure the show honors over a rival. SOULMATE chased along the inside under a ride from the three-eighths, angled five wide into upper stretch, closed well to just miss for the show honors. THINKABOUTIT chased along the inside under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, spun three wide for home, improved position to the finish. ORIGINAL chased three then two wide under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, angled four wide into upper stretch, offered no response. TURN OF EVENTS hustled from the gate, chased just off the inside until tucked inside through the turn, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and weakened in the late stages. CHUCK WILLIS (IRE) coaxed from the start, showed the way in hand along the inside coming under pressure into the turn, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, took the inside route into upper stretch and yielded straightened away, then weakened to the finish. STANDUP chased three then two wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, spun three wide for home, made no impact. SCILLY CAY chased four wide until tucked inside at the nine-sixteenths, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch and made no impact.

ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, in hand ins, coaxed 5/16, ins 1/4, weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 9 7F Dirt CR: 71. Maiden Claiming Purse 38000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $30,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be V oid).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RED D G P bumped with a rival at the start, disputed the pace loosely between foes, vied in the three path on the turn, shook clear near the five-sixteenths, extended the advantage into upper stretch and drew off under steady urging. TUNNEL VISION was hustled from the gate, pressed the pace on the outside, vied in the four path on the turn, lost touch with the winner late on that bend and proved no match while clear for the place. TWO CHUCKLES dropped well behind the rest of the field, shifted from the two path to the four path on the turn and was along for the show. MAKART saved ground while well back in the field through the turn and failed to threaten. STRATEGYFORYOU bumped with a rival while last away, moved up between foes, was urged while moving from three to five wide on the turn and came up empty. MR. BUSTA contested the pace on the inside of two opponents, vied along the rail on the turn, dropped back at the seven-sixteenths and capitulated. ERIDROMOS settled between foes, was urged two to three wide on the turn and had nothing left. THIRTY OYSTERS raced up close on the outside, dropped back near the five-eighths pole, went five then six wide under urging on the turn and failed to respond. BIG BOULDER raced just off the pace between horses, dropped back four then five wide on the turn and retreated.

ENTRY.NAME: Makart
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back, inside turn, no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Two Chuckles
ENTRY.COMMENT: well behind, 2-4path turn, along for show

ENTRY.NAME: Mr. Busta
ENTRY.COMMENT: pace inside duo, rail turn, dropped back 7/16, tired
